intro: Aphananthe negrosensis, commonly known as the Negros aphananthe, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
